page.title: 13Ingatestone - recreation.
page.content:
Ingatestone is mostly renowned for its historic hall (Ingatestone Hall) which has entertained people like Queen Elizabeth I. Tourists can walk round the hall and admire the great architecture.
The village of Ingatestone has its Boys' Club, church, football team, four pubs and many private businesses. The Boys' Club has its own snooker tables and table tennis tables; the hall is also used for private functions. The football club runs a number of teams from the under-10's to the mens' teams.
The village has three schools, one for infants, one for juniors and the large Anglo-European School for 1000 senior pupils.
